result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke R Faircloth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, advises that Defendant is prepared for plea hearing.

Defendant Luke R Faircloth in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Luke R Faircloth in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Continue to take all medications specifically as prescribed by staff at Mendota Mental Health as to drug, dosage and timing.

Defendant Luke R Faircloth in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Luke R Faircloth in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, receipt of recommendation from Dr. Hammer that Defendant has regained competency. Defense agrees, makes statement, requests that Court rely on report rather than testimony. State agrees. Court will rely upon report of Dr. Hammer, finds that Defendant has regained competency to proceed. Defense advises that Defendant will be ready to resolve cases tomorrow.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
from Vicki Shequen advising of hearing date timeframe
Competency hearing at 12-02-2015 10:30 am
Michael L. Hammer, Ph.D.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense does not believe there is any requirement for Defendant to be here, believes it would have been detrimental to Defendant and transport staff to bring him here. Court reviews possibility of video appearance. Court/Defense thought it unlikely that Defendant would have cooperated. State does not believe this hearing is needed, requests that commitment continue, hopes doctor is correct and Defendant will be restored to competence within statutory time. Defense agrees. Court makes statement, orders that Defendant remain committed.
Michael L. Hammer, Ph.D.
Competency hearing at 10-16-2015 09:00 am
of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
(rec'd by Court 7/24/15) prepared by Neil J. Brahmbhatt and Elliot R. Lee

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding need to bring Defendant to Courtroom. Counsel agree that Defendant's presence is not necessary. Defense stipulates to Court's use of report. Court finds Defendant's presence not required, adopts report, orders Defendant committed with psychotropic medications.
E-mails re: availability of bed in Mendota
Defendant to be transported to Mendota Mental Health Inst. for inpatient examination.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appears by phone on defendants behalf.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Bemmann advises defendant refuses to come up to court for hearing. Court reviews report by Dr. Galli. Court finds inpatient examination is the next course of action, orders defendant be transported to Mendota Mental Health Institute for inpatient evaluation.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Michael Galli, Ph.D., Wisconsin Forensic Unit
by Defendant
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
for Competency Examination by Dept. of Health Services
Event required to open case.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes statement regarding Defendant's refusal to participate in proceedings, reviews previous activity, advises of conversation with Court security regarding how to proceed. Defense advises that he has spoken with Defendant's sister, advises that Defendant does qualify and has a long history of mental illness, raises competency. Defense has been unable to talk with Defendant, will try again later today. Court believes Defendant will have to be brought up personally, questions State. State believes it would be appropriate after probable cause finding. Court finds probable cause, orders competency evaluation.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Luke R Faircloth not in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Video conference to jail shows empty chair. Sgt. Veeser appears on video, advises that Defendant refuses to leave cell to come to Court. Court questions whether that is consistent. Sgt. Veeser advises that he does not believe Defendant will cooperate at any time. Court questions State about other counties where charges are pending. Court reviews options (having Defendant appear involuntarily or giving Defendant time to cooperate on June 18 or prior if Defendant indicates to jail staff that he's willing to appear).  Initial appearance scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Luke R Faircloth appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 5/18/15, 10:00.
